context: In Finnish, 'ääni' is a noun that can refer to different types of sounds or voices. It's the singular form and is commonly used to describe both natural sounds (like animal noises) and human speech/singing. The word can also be used in technical contexts to refer to audio frequencies or tones. When using this word, you might encounter it in its plural form 'äänet' which would mean 'sounds' or 'voices'.
